attributes.action: Implement a tax on online pornography
attributes.background: Online Pornography is detrimental to young people’s brain. Many research suggests that porn negatively affects the brain so I’m calling for a tax on it as young people often opt for free sites. There is obviously a reason it’s been dubbed ‘the new drug’. Banning probably won’t work but a tax could.

attributes.action: Raise the legal smoking age to 19 in 2019, then raise it by 1 year annually
attributes.background: Set the legal smoking age to 19 in 2019, 20 in 2020, and raise it by one year annually. This way, the limit will always be the current year, making it easy to remember. No one would find themselves banned if they already smoke. However, anyone currently under 19 would be prevented from taking it up.
attributes.additional_details:
The minimum age at which you can buy cigarettes in the UK is at present 18.

In 2016/17 there were estimated to be 484,700 hospital admissions attributable to smoking (Hospital Episode Statistics), and in 2016 there were estimated to be 77,900 deaths attributable to smoking in the UK (Office for National Statistics).

Tobacco smoking destroys lives and families, while megacorporations haul their massive profits to the bank. If you believe it should be phased out, please lend your support to this petition.

attributes.action: Remove the smoking ban in mental health units/psychiatric units
attributes.background:
Remove the smoking ban in mental health units in hospitals across the country and allow mental health patients a very basic freedom of choice. 
A designated smoking area for psychiatric patients isn't much to ask for, especially when the old smoking areas are still there.
attributes.additional_details:
I have been sectioned under the mental health act since the smoking ban came into effect. It now enforces severely unwell people to quit smoking suddenly, with no choice but to comply. Whilst under section you are not permitted to leave the ward and there is not a designated smoking area in any ward.
This wasn't always the case, in fact there are still designated smoking areas In all mental health units that are now disused. It's cruel to force a person to quit smoking at such a difficult point in their lives.

attributes.action: Abolish the time limitation act 1980 regarding money owed
attributes.background:
I feel that this law should be changed  to enable people to get their money back 
Court costs are too prohibitive following the six year time bar limit
attributes.additional_details: I am sure I am not alone when it comes to being in this situation

attributes.action: Make all knives sold into and throughout the U.K microchipped and to become law.
attributes.background: 3 in 4 knife crimes committed in England and Wales are unresolved. Microchipping knives in the handle AND blade will give police traceability of knives used in crimes. Discarded and or forgotten knives means that the perpetrator(s) are more likely to be caught in a quicker timeframe and convicted.
attributes.additional_details: National office of statistics 2005 to 2018. Police knife amnesty in June 2005. Police Cheif Reports.

attributes.action: Review the UK Parliament-Government petition site.
attributes.background: I believe that the Parliament-Government petition site is a farce and the people's voice is not listened to. Petitions unpopular with government do not get the proper attention and are hamstrung from the start.
attributes.additional_details: Rejected petitions get a copy and paste response. The first chance to reject petitions is done with a copy and paste response "It is unclear what you want the Government or Parliament to do." In the unlikely event that it gets past this point, a government response is given at the first milestone and a farcical "debate" confirms the "government line." This has to change.

attributes.action: I want disability education to become a mandatory lesson in all schools.
attributes.background: I suffer with cerebral palsy as a result of complications during birth and having witnessed several incidents in which people are subject to abuse because they seem like normal people but they have to use a wheelchair for certain situations.

attributes.action: Require the NHS to notify patients whose test results are at risk of delay
attributes.background: There is currently no system in place to notify patients if their results are caught up in a backlog, and from a personal point of view this can lead to great stress and anxiety.
attributes.additional_details:
It should be part of law/the NHS Constitution to notify patients of notable delays as this can cause distress.
 
According to "Standards for the communication of patient diagnostic test results on discharge from hospital" (NHS England, March 2016), the stress and anxiety on a patient in the delay of the results has been acknowledged, and they claimed "reviews" were being carried out.

attributes.action: Allow 16-year-olds to ride 125cc Scooters/Mopeds
attributes.background: Allowing 16-year-olds to ride 125cc Mopeds would improve lots of areas, firstly, it would reduce traffic on 40mph roads as most 50cc mopeds are limited to 30mph, secondly, it would decrease the amount of tailgating to riders of 50cc mopeds which is dangerous and could cause accidents
attributes.additional_details: For anyone that is unaware about this topic, 16-year-olds can legally ride 50cc Scooters/Mopeds which are limited to around 30mph, but when he/she reaches 17, they can legally ride 125cc which can usually reach around 60mph. Myself and many others believe that 16-year-olds should be allowed to ride 125cc mopeds to help the issues I stated before

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for out-of-school groups to have child protection policies
attributes.background: Having worked in a Faith-based organisation myself and being aware of local groups that do not have child protection policies in place, I am concerned about young people who attend such places. When I have personally approached the leaders of such places in good faith, I have been turned away.
attributes.additional_details: Groups, including faith-based groups such as churches and mosques, which run after-school clubs need to be registered on a database and ground rules need to be put in place by a statutory body to help monitor the progress and implementation of basic rights of the young people who attend places of worship and other groups for religious education or other activities. Some groups are not concerned with the bureaucracy of child protection.

attributes.action: Allow towns to sack county police force and form a town or city force if failed
attributes.background: County police forces do not spread resources correctly and need more police on our streets. Allow constituencies to hold a town vote on whether their police force is better handled by the county or locally in your town or city. Funding from council tax budget which is paid to county force will fund.
attributes.additional_details: Sussex police have failed to tackle many crimes in our area and hardly see a police presence on a day to day basis, youth crime, vehicle crime and public disorder is at a all time high in Arun. Chief Constable York has failed our town. The people deserve this responsibility to have their lives and well being protected.

attributes.action: Reform law to safeguard public interests ensuring against abuse of police power
attributes.background: We need a full review of police powers to recommend ways to reform the police. The review must cover whether the police target innocent people and act to avoid accountability. It must look for illegality, irrationality, impropriety in procedures, and failure to abide by rules of natural justice.
attributes.additional_details: The police can target innocent people on the street or at home by saying that a crime was reported, intelligence was received, or they said or did something that looked suspicious. To protect the public from abuse of police powers, the review must consider whether the police must be made to provide within 14 days evidence to the individual/s of why that person was stopped, questioned or visited by the police and whether the police should have to apply to the court if they want to withhold any records/evidence.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of 7.5% Cheap White Cider which is highly addictive and deadly!
attributes.background:
White Cider is likened to the 'heroin' of drinks. It is so cheap and widely available, it is popular with those in society that have very little income.
Cheap White Cider is easy to produce from imported apple juice, so does not impact the British Cider Industry.
attributes.additional_details:
Just a few examples........
https://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/terribly-sad-story-victim-cheap-15105742
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/16-year-old-girl-died-9864006
https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4248242/Teenager-16-died-bingeing-3-49-cider.html
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/nov/12/super-strength-cider-lager-killer-on-britain-streets-homelessness-rough-sleepers
https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2011/apr/17/cider-industry-protected-expense-alcoholics

attributes.action: Mandatory minimum sentence for shaken baby deaths no guilty plea reduction.
attributes.background: We are calling for a mandatory minimum sentence of 15 years when an offender kills a child through shaking the infant. This should also mean that they are not eligible for the reduction in sentence when pleading guilty to get a lower jail term.
attributes.additional_details: The case of Lee Sweet who pled guilty to manslaughter of his son should serve as a warning that this should never happen again. No family should have to wait a year to lay to rest such a precious life, let alone have to watch as he received a third reduction in sentence for pleading guilty after 11 months of denying it.

attributes.action: Renumber the A1(M) from Leeds to Newcastle as the M1
attributes.background: As the A1 has now been upgraded to motorway standard from Leeds to Newcastle for the entire length,to the A1(M), it would make more sense to renumber this section as t he M1, to create a continuous M1 motorway from London to Newcastle.
attributes.additional_details: Renumbering the A1(M) to the M1 would be enormously beneficial to the counties of Yorkshire, County Durham and Tyne and Wear.

attributes.action: Declassify first class carriages on all rush hour trains
attributes.background: Given the rising cost of train travel, it’s utterly unacceptable that hard-working commuters aren’t guaranteed a seat. Declassifying first class carriages can at least alleviate the issue. It is archaic, and totally unjustifiable when commuters are literally falling over each other in standard class

attributes.action: Maintenance payments (inc Spousal) as an attachment of Earnings or via Court
attributes.background: When maintenance is not paid after a Court has ordered it it is wrong to have to keep going back to Court to enforce. Apart from the trauma that you go through for years in my case, and the cost which ran into thousands, why should you have to wait and fight again after an order is made
attributes.additional_details:
It is also a fact that the time it takes to enforce can put that person into even more debt, or the chance to lose their home when maintenance isn’t paid.
It is obvious the person isn’t going to want to pay, which is why it ends up in Court, so why is this not taken as an attachment of earnings or via Court within the order?
The system doesn’t allow for both parties to get on with their lives as it states is the purpose when the one side is always unsure of receiving what was fought for

attributes.action: Start safeguarding parents from abusive ex-partners.
attributes.background: I want to safeguard mothers and fathers who have been victims of abuse from and ex partner. We must change the law and guidance to prevent parents from being expected to enter mediation with their abuser.
attributes.additional_details: Many women and men are expected to mediate with abusive ex-partners for the ‘benefit’ of the child whilst no safeguarding is considered for the parent who has to mediate with someone who mentally, physically or sexually assaulted them. Many parents’ well-being is forgotten in these circumstances, and lives can be put at risk if we keep ignoring this.

attributes.action: HGVs restricted to first two lanes of motorways & be restricted at peak times.
attributes.background: HGVs, vehicles above 7.5 tonnes, cause restricted traffic flow when overtaking on motorways during busy periods.  HGVs should be restricted to the 1st lane during peak hours, using overhead signage, and should not be able to enter the third lane on four lane motorways.
attributes.additional_details: These restrictions are already in place all over the European motorway network and help traffic flow.

attributes.action: Update food allergies laws to list allergens on menus in food establishments
attributes.background: In 2014, food allergies laws were passed for food establishments to tell customers if their food contains ingredients known to trigger allergies. It has recently become apparent staff don't always provide the correct information. An update is needed to make it compulsory for the info to be on menus

attributes.action: Nationalise UK mobile telephone masts.
attributes.background: 6 December 2018, O2 experienced a widespread failure affecting 20m+ UK customers. However other network providers continued to enjoy access. This petition would bring into public hands the network of phone masts, thus guaranteeing equality of access for customers.
attributes.additional_details:
Mobile data access is a key part of working and personal life for almost all people in the UK today. 

To have access for some and not for others when a network goes down is depriving large segments of the population with the ability to be productive, happy, and even safe.

It does not need to be this way, if the hardware of UK mobile data coverage was recognised as a natural monopoly and brought into public hands so it could also be managed in the public interest, all would be better off.

attributes.action: Change student loan arrangements to reflect career success
attributes.background:
The current arrangements reduce the incentive for students to achieve high-earning roles. Successful students see their debt increase every year until they are earning 4 x the average salary. 
Lower earners may never repay anything. This situation cannot be justified.
attributes.additional_details: The interest on the debt should be fixed at the no more than half a percent above the Bank of England rate when the loan is issued. Repayment should then be taken from all earnings/income (with no lower limit) at a rate that would pay the interest charges and reduce the outstanding balance. If students never work then the loan should be collected by a small reduction in any benefits.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of possible depo provera injection side effects
attributes.background: Depo provera injection for birth control and to stop periods I chose this was right treatment for myself only to of met my partner and us decide we want to try for a baby well as we looked deeply on the internet to see what side effects I would well what we found out was really bad and shocking.
attributes.additional_details: The mood swings, irregular periods, and potentially getting bone loss density which some women have through this the reading just shocked me if I had done more research 4+ years ago I would of never of had it. I think this injection should come with a warning label or taken off the market our nurses and doctors just don't know enough and should be well trained in this.

attributes.action: Force rail companies to freeze rail fares for at least 5 years.
attributes.background: The new rise in rail fares is criminal and only lining the pockets of the wealthy running the trains in Britain. We demand that the rail fares be frozen so that people are not being stripped of their cash and being made poorer just to get to work.

attributes.action: Renegotiate the Brexit deal immediately in the event MPs vote against it
attributes.background: If MPs vote against the Brexit deal, the Government shall immediatley seek to negotiate an improved deal, including ensuring the U.K. will have a unilateral right to leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario thereby honouring the leave vote and working to avoid a “no deal” scenario
attributes.additional_details: The referendum vote to leave is compromised by the inability of the U.K. to unilaterally leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario. In the highly likely event MPs vote against the deal the Government must commit to return to the EU to negotiate an improved deal, for example to amend the Withdrawal Agreement to create a unilateral right to leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario and to reduce the Brexit bill; to be done immediatley and urgently after the vote

attributes.action: Require unused hospital and pharmacy prescriptions to be reused, not thrown out
attributes.background: My client was a pharmacist in a UK hospital. All prescriptions that were not collected from patients are put in the bin if not collected and not reused. this is a complete waste of money. They are not opened and not used we need to stop this.

attributes.action: Reform GDPR/Data Law with Automatic Fines on Bodies/Organisations not Complying
attributes.background: Since the GDPR was updated in May 2018 some public bodies/organisations still do not comply. Reform GDPR/Data Law to impose Automatic Daily Fines for failure to respond/comply with a data request within 1 month. If any records are withhold an automatic fine of the ICO maximum of £500,000 must apply
attributes.additional_details: If public bodies/organisations wish to recover some of the costs of the fines they will have to appeal to court to prove which information is being withheld/concealed from individuals & why, how the information was gathered & generated or records contaminated. If proven there is an attempt to obstruct justice those involved should be ordered to pay towards the fine/costs. We must have accountability across our public services, every individual in the UK is entitled to access to all their records

attributes.action: legally require a receipt to be printed only if a customer actually wants one
attributes.background: Many large companies automatically print receipts for customers after small transactions (namely fast food shops and brands offering a self service experience). Customers often do not take these receipts. This is an incredible waste of paper that is not justifiable and can be easily avoided.

attributes.action: SELECTIVE licensing for tenants should be removed or applied for all landlords.
attributes.background:
SELECTIVE licensing for certain areas and certain landlords is unfair.

The law should be same for all where ever you live in the country.

This should also be applied to letting agencies and housing estates.
attributes.additional_details:
Lisence is applied when you commence a business and require authority of the council this should be same for everyone not selective.

Also the law should be applied to council areas not privately owned.

Safety of tenants can also be address in many other ways.

We are all equal in England and the law should be passed for all not few.

attributes.action: Require differential off-peak electricity rates.
attributes.background: The energy companies have eroded the differential between the night time and day time electricity tariffs, originally introduced to provide competition to other providers of energy, such as oil and gas.
attributes.additional_details: The recent hikes in off-peak rates for electricity have made heating homes for users of storage heaters, in particular, very difficult. Many people, often pensioners, invested in this form of central heating years ago and would find a change to oil (or gas if available) central heating prohibitive.

attributes.action: UK to sign the United Nations Convention on Migrants’ Rights
attributes.background:
The International Convention on the Protection of the Rights
of All Migrant Workers and Members of Their Families is a United Nations multilateral treaty governing the protection of migrant workers and families. It has still not been signed by the UK despite being adopted by General Assembly 1990.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.ohchr.org/en/professionalinterest/pages/cmw.aspx

attributes.action: More Money For Unemployed
attributes.background: Unemployed People Like Myself Struggle To Put Food On The Table. Afford Gas And Electric And Rent Top Ups. We Should Get Additional Support From DWP

attributes.action: Inspect and license all breeders of horses and ponies to prevent suffering
attributes.background: The government must introduce and enforce inspection and licensing of breeders to prevent cruel exploitative breeding of poor quality horses and ponies. The licensing fee will pay for the enforcement. Please lobby your MP and Michael Gove Minister for DEFRA responsible for horse welfare.

attributes.action: Reduce the age of buying beer and alco-pops 5% and under, wine under 13% to 16
attributes.background: We would like the legal age of purchasing certain alcoholic beverages to the age of 16. By reducing the purchasing of beer and wine to 16 there will be less consumption of hard spirits as well as the use of counterfeit identification. This will promote a safer way for children to experiment.
attributes.additional_details: This theory is modelled on many European countries laws; Belgium, Germany and Spain. In 2016, 7,327 people died from alcohol related deaths of which many were caused by excessive drinking of spirits. The countries current legislation promotes the use of spirits for underage teenagers to become intoxicated. So by legalising a safer alternative to consume alcohol, which is an inevitability, there will be a decrease in alcohol related medical conditions in underage teenagers.

attributes.action: Pause further UK North Sea Oil and Gas Decommissioning Until 2040.
attributes.background:
The UK has already met and exceeded its EU 2030 co2 emissions reduction target of  40% reduction on 1990 levels.
There are 11.7bn barrels oil in existing  UK wells, worth £724.581Bn.
It is irrational to pay $80 per barrel to import a resource that we have. Decommissioning should be paused til 2040
attributes.additional_details:
OIL is and will remain necessary for 60m tonnes per year European plastics industry. Fuel extraction currently supports 320 000 UK jobs.Oil import supply/price is vulnerable to global instability.
sources:
http://www.thenational.scot/news/16059661.north-sea-set-for-oil-boom-as-estimates-are-increased-by-billions-of-barrels/
https://oilandgasuk.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/Workforce-Report-2017-Oil-Gas-UK.pdf
https://www.statista.com/statistics/282732/global-production-of-plastics-since-1950/

attributes.action: Consider funding a northern bypass for Ipswich.
attributes.background: The Orwell bridge. A14. Major artery from the expanding port of felixstowe. When the bridge gets closed in either direction due to bad weather, usually high winds, or a road traffic incident. All traffic is diverted through Ipswich town which causes absolute mayhem.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-44656588

One particular day the wind brought down trees and blocked local roads which were already congested due to tge bridge closure. This particular day it took me 90 minutes to get to work, 7 miles away...! There was an idea of allowing cars only in high winds but surely that would pose health and safefy issues.

attributes.action: Change 30 hours free child care eligible 51 weeks a year instead of term time
attributes.background: Current funding of 30 free hours only covers term time which for most working parents only actually covers maybe a day and a half child care as like me most work full time meaning if you have more then 1 child costs soon add up.  get the government to change 30hours free a week not just in term

attributes.action: Income Tax changes to be more diverse either individual or per house hold
attributes.background: Currently income tax works on an individual basis, therefore if a household has two workers at 35k they both pay 20% tax each, however in a family with children only one adult works they are penalised after 46k,
attributes.additional_details:
Council tax and other taxes work on the basis of per house hold so why not for Income Tax, changing this to a per household rate allowing partners to absorb/ utilise the tax allowance prior to the increase to 40% and/or 50%. 

Example could be: Adult 1 salary 20k, Adult 2 salary 60k tax would only increase to 40% once 80k mark has hit, this would aide families where only one parent is working and/ or coupled adults living under a single roof

attributes.action: Bring in minimum standards for certain camping equipment sold in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a huge amount of camping equipment abandoned at festivals every year which is bad for the environment. Much of the equipment is of a poor standard and inadequate for the British summer leading to many people getting cold and wet to the extent that they need medical help.
attributes.additional_details:
Minimum standards should be -
Tents must have an inner and outer skin and a minimum Hydrostatic Head rating of 3000. (Small play tents can be exempt.)
Any sleeping bag rated as suitable only for temperatures over 5 degrees centigrade should be clearly labelled "UK Indoors Only".
Roll mats must have a minimum thickness when compressed. 
All folding chairs and stools must have their maximum weight clearly displayed in kilogrammes and stones and pounds, in large letters on the sales label.

attributes.action: Require councils to provide lollypop men and women
attributes.background: Stop any councils in England from using the funds for road crossing supervisors (Lollypop men and Women) to save money. The UK Government should provide additional funding for councils if necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Please check out https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/burton/school-crossing-patrol-staffordshire-cuts-1997550 and ITV central news 13/9/18

attributes.action: Add Middle Rate Mobility for children receiving Disability Living Allowance
attributes.background:
My 10 year daughter has hyper mobility type Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, she has low muscle tone, subluxations of joints, swelling of joints, widespread joint pain to name a few symptoms. 
She has ankle braces, insoles, a wheelchair and other aids to help but she has never been entitled to mobility.
attributes.additional_details:
There is 3 rates of care but only 2 for mobility and the criterias for 2 rates don’t accomadate for children like my daughter. 
For LRM the criteria is the child needs ‘guidance or supervision with walking on unfamiliar routes’ and for HRM the criteria is the child must be unable to walk, virtually unable to walk, have no legs or feet, be SMI, be SVI, be blind and deaf or be a danger to them self. There should be an in between for children who have days where they need a wheelchair etc.

attributes.action: Require schools to sell logos to sew on to uniforms
attributes.background: Uniform costs are rising and parents are having to worry about meeting these costs. If schools were made to sell their logos to sew onto cheaper alternatives this would alleviate a massive burden. Instead of paying £50 for a blazer cheaper ones are available at a fraction of the cost etc.

attributes.action: Create a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children
attributes.background: Introduce a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children. I propose a small tax on all goods sold in England. The tax money will buy food for starving African children. Food security is very important, because when people have no money or food, eventually wars happen.
attributes.additional_details: Overall, 5.6 million children under age five died in 2016, nearly 15,000 daily. The risk of a child dying before five years of age is highest in Africa - about 8 times higher than in Europe. Eventually if other countries from around the world put a tax on their goods too, this international tax money would help collapsed economies from around the world, so it would be like a world social security ensuring the world to be a safer world to live in for everyone.

attributes.action: Ban tying up pets outside of buildings, shops ect.
attributes.background: Leaving pets unaccompanied tied up out of shops and buildings can be distressing for the animal and potentially lead to pet theft, if unaccompanied for a long time.
attributes.additional_details: On numerous occasions I have witnessed dogs tied up outside of betting shops, supermarkets and convenience stores in clear distress. Barking, shaking and crying. If this was a child it would be deemed unacceptable so why is it acceptable for pets (puppies and adults) to be tied up whilst careless owners do as they like.

attributes.action: Force Social Media Companies to provide users with an opt-in time limit feature
attributes.background: As a nation we spend more and more of our time on Social Media. People are often shocked to see just how much time they spend on these sites. Numerous reports and studies have been released about the adverse effects this is having on our Mental Health, but nothing is ever done about it.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition proposes that Social Media platforms should be required to provide an optional time limit feature to users. This way people can decide for themselves exactly how much time they choose to allocate to Social Media. 

These companies know that their users are addicted but its not in their interest to be part of the solution. This feature will allow people to take control of their usage. 

Fight back and give yourself the tools you need to protect your Mental Health

attributes.action: Increase the minimum gambling age to 21
attributes.background: Investing in the youth begins with removing unfavourable distractions from their environment. There is no logic in students leaving education to in contrast be exposed to negative influences such as; alcohol, becoming addicted to drugs or equally gambling!
attributes.additional_details:
A recent study shows that approximately 96% of gamblers are doing so in their home (Gambling Commission, 2019) which means that, it becomes easier for everyone regardless of age group to have access to gambling tools. 

Having worked for one of the top bookmakers for over several years I have seen firsthand some of the damage gambling is doing to people of all ages

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for cat owners to spay/Neuter their cats.
attributes.background: The spaying /neutering of cats needs to be made compulsory. Shelters are struggling to cope with the numbers of unwanted cats. There is also a very large number of strays/ferals on the streets who are struggling to survive. Cat owners need to take responsibility.
attributes.additional_details: Kittens are old enough to be spayed/neutered at 16 weeks.

attributes.action: IVF & fertility treatments to be funded by government to allow couples one child
attributes.background: There are so many medical conditions that cause fertility problems in men and women, none of these are their fault but we suffer so much trauma and injustice as a result. Enough is enough, we need a fairer system to ensure that everyone who wants a child can have one without being crippled by debt.
attributes.additional_details:
It's not just the medical condition the person is dealing with:-  
-The pain
-The feelings of guilt and self loathing
-Depression 
-Potential operations 
-Time off work and financial problems 
-Feeling we are letting our partner down
-Then the ridiculous postcode lottery system to fund IVF allowing some people in Britain 3 cycles of IVF, 2 cycles, 1 cycle or nothing at all. This is as ridiculous as deciding who gets IVF by their class and it takes most women over 2 cycles of IVF to fall pregnant

attributes.action: Stop Fracking Right Away!
attributes.background: Stop Fracking right away or any other drilling’s in the ground for supplies. 17 earthquakes have happened in the last 5 months in Surrey, one just hitting 2 days ago with a magnitude of 3. This never used to happen in the uk! Why can’t we keep UK to be that “one of the safest countries”?
attributes.additional_details: Fracking has proven to cause water pollution and earthquakes in the USA which can have dire consequences. Even if it was safe, should we start becoming less reliant on fossil fuel? They won't be around forever and we need to be prepared for when that time comes. A government survey recently showed that only 16% of people support fracking. We are a country of democracy and should respect the will of the public.

attributes.action: Tax fatty foods significantly and use that money to subsidize healthy foods.
attributes.background:
As the obesity rate increases within the United Kingdom, it is for the better if there was a "fat tax".

How it could work:
- Fatty foods get taxed more, and so we use that money to subsidize healthier food.

For example:
- A burger costs £2 a piece while veg and healthy meat is almost free.
attributes.additional_details:
"In 2016, 26 per cent of adults were classified as obese. This has increased from 15 per cent in 1993 but has remained at a similar level since 2010." "In 2016, 26 per cent of adults and 16 per cent of children consumed 5 or more portions of fruit and vegetables a day.
" - https://digital.nhs.uk/data-and-information/publications/statistical/statistics-on-obesity-physical-activity-and-diet/statistics-on-obesity-physical-activity-and-diet-england-2018
